doc_title: Setting Up a Mobile Device for Company Email
title: Set Up Company Email on Mobile Device
summary: Procedure for configuring a company email account on a mobile device (iOS, Android, or Windows), including MDM requirements and security settings.
signatures: cannot connect to company email server

steps.instruction: If your company requires Mobile Device Management (MDM), ensure the MDM profile is installed on your device. If unsure, contact IT.
steps.expected_observation: MDM profile is installed if required.

steps.instruction: Open the Settings app on your mobile device.
steps.expected_observation: Settings app is open.

steps.instruction: Select 'Mail' or 'Email' (depending on your device's OS).
steps.expected_observation: Mail/Email settings screen is visible.

steps.instruction: Tap 'Add Account' or 'Create a new account'.
steps.expected_observation: Account type selection screen is shown.

steps.instruction: Select 'Exchange' or 'Corporate' as the account type.
steps.expected_observation: Exchange/Corporate account setup screen is displayed.

steps.instruction: Enter your company email address and password.
steps.expected_observation: Credentials accepted or prompt for server details.

steps.instruction: If prompted, enter the company's email server address (e.g., mail.company.com).
steps.expected_observation: Server address accepted.

steps.instruction: Select desired synchronization options (email, contacts, calendar).
steps.expected_observation: Sync options selected.

steps.instruction: In account settings, select 'Advanced' or 'Security' and ensure 'Use SSL/TLS' or 'Use secure connection' is enabled.
steps.expected_observation: Secure connection enabled.

steps.instruction: Set authentication method to 'Username and Password' or 'Domain\Username'. If prompted, enter your company's email domain.
steps.expected_observation: Authentication method set and domain entered if needed.

steps.instruction: Wait for the email account to synchronize with the company email server.
steps.expected_observation: Account sync completes without error.

steps.instruction: Send a test email to yourself or a colleague to verify sending and receiving.
steps.expected_observation: Test email is sent and received successfully.

verify_prompts: Can you send and receive emails from your company account on your mobile device?
Is your company email account visible and syncing in the Mail/Email app?

doc_title: Resetting a Forgotten PIN
title: Reset Forgotten PIN Using Self-Service Tool
summary: Guide for users to reset a forgotten PIN using the company's self-service PIN Reset Tool.

steps.instruction: Go to the company's intranet homepage and click on the 'IT Support' link at the top right corner of the page.
steps.expected_observation: IT Support page is displayed.

steps.instruction: Click on the 'Self-Service' tab and select 'PIN Reset' from the drop-down menu.
steps.expected_observation: Redirected to the PIN Reset Tool login page.

steps.instruction: Enter your company username and password in the required fields and click the 'Login' button.
steps.expected_observation: Prompted to answer your security question.

steps.instruction: Enter the answer to your security question and click 'Next'.
steps.expected_observation: Prompted to enter a new PIN.

steps.instruction: Enter a new PIN (at least 8 characters, mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters) and confirm it by re-entering.
steps.expected_observation: Able to click 'Reset PIN' button.
steps.safety_notes: Do not share your PIN with anyone.

steps.instruction: Click the 'Reset PIN' button to complete the process.
steps.expected_observation: Confirmation message indicating PIN has been successfully reset.

steps.instruction: Click the 'OK' button to close the confirmation message.
steps.expected_observation: Returned to the PIN Reset Tool or homepage.

steps.instruction: Have you attempted to reset your PIN more than 3 times in the last 24 hours?
steps.expected_observation: If yes, self-service reset is blocked.
steps.safety_notes: If limit exceeded, user must contact IT Helpdesk.

verify_prompts: Can you log in to company systems and applications with your new PIN?
Did you receive a confirmation message that your PIN was reset?
escalate_requirements: Confirmation of PIN reset limit reached

doc_title: Resetting a Forgotten PIN
title: Reset Forgotten PIN via IT Helpdesk
summary: Procedure for users who cannot reset their PIN using the self-service tool, or have exceeded the reset limit.

steps.instruction: Contact the IT Helpdesk via phone or email and provide your username and details of the issue.
steps.expected_observation: Helpdesk acknowledges your request.

steps.instruction: Provide any requested evidence (e.g., screenshots, timestamps, error messages) to the IT Helpdesk.
steps.expected_observation: Helpdesk processes your PIN reset request.

steps.instruction: Follow any further instructions from the IT Helpdesk to complete the PIN reset.
steps.expected_observation: PIN reset is completed by the Helpdesk.

verify_prompts: Did the IT Helpdesk confirm your PIN has been reset?
Can you now access company systems with your new PIN?

doc_title: Troubleshooting Issues with Microsoft Office
title: General Troubleshooting for Microsoft Office Applications
summary: Step-by-step procedure to resolve common issues with Microsoft Office applications such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

steps.instruction: Restart the Microsoft Office application experiencing issues.
steps.expected_observation: Application restarts successfully.

steps.instruction: Open any Microsoft Office application, go to File > Account, and click Update Options
Install any available updates and restart the application.
steps.expected_observation: Office is updated to the latest version.

steps.instruction: Go to File > Options > Add-ins. Uncheck boxes next to each add-in to disable them. Click OK to save changes.
steps.expected_observation: Add-ins are disabled in the application.

steps.instruction: Try opening a new, blank document in the affected Office application to check if the issue persists.
steps.expected_observation: Issue does not occur with a new document, indicating possible file corruption.

steps.instruction: Close all other programs and background applications to check for conflicts with Microsoft Office.
steps.expected_observation: Issue is resolved after closing conflicting programs.

steps.instruction: Open Command Prompt as administrator and run: officec2rclient.exe /uninstall. Wait for completion and restart the computer.
steps.expected_observation: Office configuration is reset and computer restarts.
steps.safety_notes: Resetting configuration may remove custom Office settings.

steps.instruction: Uninstall Microsoft Office via Control Panel > Programs and Features, then reinstall from the software portal or IT department.
steps.expected_observation: Microsoft Office is reinstalled and launches successfully.
steps.safety_notes: Uninstalling Office will remove all Office applications from the device.

verify_prompts: Is the Microsoft Office application now working as expected?
Can you open and edit documents without errors?
Are all required features and add-ins functioning?

doc_title: Setting Up a Conference Call on Cisco Webex
title: Schedule and Host a Conference Call on Cisco Webex
summary: How to schedule, configure, and start a conference call using Cisco Webex, including audio/video setup and sending invitations.

steps.instruction: Open a web browser and navigate to the company Webex URL. Log in with your company credentials.
steps.expected_observation: Webex portal dashboard is visible.

steps.instruction: Click on the 'Meetings' tab and select 'Schedule a Meeting'. Fill in the meeting topic, start and end time, duration, and add invitees.
steps.expected_observation: Meeting details form is filled out.

steps.instruction: In the 'Audio' section, select 'Cisco Webex Audio' as the default audio type. Optionally, allow participants to join via phone or VoIP.
steps.expected_observation: Audio settings are configured.

steps.instruction: If video is desired, click on the 'Video' tab and select 'Cisco Webex Video' as the default video type
Optionally, allow participants to join via video.
steps.expected_observation: Video settings are configured (if enabled).

steps.instruction: Optionally, add an agenda and notes to the meeting invitation by clicking on the 'Agenda' tab.
steps.expected_observation: Agenda and notes are visible to invitees (if added).

steps.instruction: Click 'Schedule' to send the meeting invitation to all invitees.
steps.expected_observation: Invitees receive meeting invitations with join link and dial-in information.

steps.instruction: At the scheduled time, click 'Start' to begin the conference call. Enter your audio and video settings as prompted.
steps.expected_observation: Meeting starts and participants can join.

verify_prompts: Is the meeting visible in your Webex Meetings list?
Did invitees receive the meeting invitation?
Can you and invitees join the meeting successfully?

doc_title: Troubleshooting Issues with Company-Issued Tablets
title: Basic Troubleshooting for Company-Issued Tablets
summary: Step-by-step troubleshooting for common issues with company-issued tablets, including power cycling, software updates, safe mode, app troubleshooting, factory reset, and hardware checks.

steps.instruction: Press and hold the power button until the tablet shuts down. Wait 30 seconds, then press the power button again to turn the tablet back on.
steps.expected_observation: Tablet restarts successfully.

steps.instruction: Ensure the tablet is connected to the internet
Go to Settings > System > System Update
Check for and install any available software updates
Restart the tablet after installation.
steps.expected_observation: Tablet is up to date and restarts.

steps.instruction: Restart the tablet in safe mode: Power off
power on while holding the Volume Down button until safe mode loads
Observe if the issue persists in safe mode.
steps.expected_observation: Tablet boots into safe mode. Issue may or may not persist.

steps.instruction: Identify the problematic app
Go to Settings > Apps > [App Name]
Clear the app's cache and data
Restart the app and check if the issue is resolved.
steps.expected_observation: App functions normally after clearing cache/data.

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > System > Advanced > Reset Options
steps.safety_notes: This step will erase all data on the tablet. Ensure data is backed up.

steps.instruction: Select 'Erase all data (factory reset)'
steps.safety_notes: This step will erase all data on the tablet. Ensure data is backed up.

steps.instruction: Follow prompts to complete the reset
steps.safety_notes: This step will erase all data on the tablet. Ensure data is backed up.

steps.instruction: Ensure all important data is backed up before proceeding.
steps.expected_observation: Tablet resets to factory settings. All data is erased.
steps.safety_notes: This step will erase all data on the tablet. Ensure data is backed up.

steps.instruction: Inspect the tablet for physical damage. Check the charging port for debris. Try a different charging cable or power source.
steps.expected_observation: No physical damage or charging issues found, or issue identified.

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > System > About Tablet. Record the OS version, device ID, and any error messages for support.
steps.expected_observation: Diagnostic information collected.

verify_prompts: Is the tablet functioning normally after completing these steps?
Does the issue persist in safe mode?
Is the problematic app working after clearing cache and data?
escalate_requirements: Diagnostic information (OS version, device ID, error messages)

doc_title: Setting Up a Secure Wireless Network
title: Set Up a Secure Wireless Network
summary: Guidance for planning, configuring, and maintaining a secure wireless network using modern protocols and best practices.

steps.instruction: Plan your wireless network by identifying the number of users, devices, and access points required
Determine the type of encryption and authentication methods to be used
Consider the physical layout and wireless signal range.
steps.expected_observation: A documented plan for network layout, device count, and security requirements.

steps.instruction: Select a secure wireless protocol such as WPA2-PSK (AES) or WPA3-PSK (AES-256)
Avoid using WEP or WPA
Ensure all devices and access points support the chosen protocol.
steps.expected_observation: All devices and access points support WPA2-PSK or WPA3-PSK.

steps.instruction: Create a strong wireless network password with at least 12 characters, including uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters
Avoid common or guessable passwords.
steps.expected_observation: A strong, unique password is generated.

steps.instruction: Log in to the router's web interface using HTTPS
steps.safety_notes: Changing SSID or password will disconnect currently connected devices.

steps.instruction: Change the default admin password and SSID
steps.safety_notes: Changing SSID or password will disconnect currently connected devices.

steps.instruction: Enable WPA2-PSK or WPA3-PSK encryption and set the strong password
steps.safety_notes: Changing SSID or password will disconnect currently connected devices.

steps.instruction: Save changes.
steps.expected_observation: Router admin password and SSID changed; encryption enabled.
steps.safety_notes: Changing SSID or password will disconnect currently connected devices.

steps.instruction: If guest access is needed, set up a separate guest network with a different SSID and password to isolate from the main network.
steps.expected_observation: Guest network is visible and separate from main network.

steps.instruction: Enable the router's firewall and configure it to block unnecessary incoming and outgoing ports. Allow only necessary incoming traffic.
steps.expected_observation: Firewall is enabled and unnecessary ports are blocked.

steps.instruction: Configure Quality of Service (QoS) settings to prioritize critical network traffic such as video conferencing or VoIP.
steps.expected_observation: QoS rules are set for critical applications.

steps.instruction: Segment the network into different zones or subnets to restrict access to sensitive areas.
steps.expected_observation: Network is divided into separate zones or subnets.

steps.instruction: Regularly check for and install router firmware updates to ensure the latest security patches are applied.
steps.expected_observation: Router firmware is up to date.
steps.safety_notes: Firmware updates may cause temporary downtime.

steps.instruction: Regularly monitor the network for suspicious activity, such as unknown devices or unusual traffic
Use network monitoring tools or consult IT if needed.
steps.expected_observation: No unknown devices or suspicious activity detected.

verify_prompts: Is the wireless network visible and secured with WPA2-PSK or WPA3-PSK?
Can only authorized users connect to the main network?
Is the guest network isolated from the main network (if configured)?
Are there no unknown devices connected to the network?
escalate_requirements: List of devices and their connection status

doc_title: Resetting a Jammed Printer
title: Reset a Jammed Printer
summary: Step-by-step procedure to safely reset a printer that has a paper jam.

steps.instruction: Turn off the printer using the power button to prevent further damage.
steps.expected_observation: Printer is powered off.
steps.safety_notes: Ensure the printer is fully powered down before proceeding.

steps.instruction: Open the printer's access panel (top, front, or back) to access the internal mechanisms.
steps.expected_observation: Access panel is open and internal components are visible.
steps.safety_notes: Be gentle when opening the panel to avoid breaking latches.

steps.instruction: Carefully remove any visible jammed paper or scraps. Avoid touching internal components or rollers.
steps.expected_observation: All visible jammed paper is removed.
steps.safety_notes: Do not use excessive force. Avoid touching rollers with bare hands.

steps.instruction: Inspect the paper path, tray, rollers, and print head for obstructions or debris. Remove any found.
steps.expected_observation: No visible obstructions or debris remain.

steps.instruction: If the paper tray was dislodged, realign and secure it according to the manufacturer's instructions.
steps.expected_observation: Paper tray is properly aligned and clicks into place.

steps.instruction: Check the print head for blockages or dried ink. Clean gently with a lint-free cloth or cotton swab if needed.
steps.expected_observation: Print head is clean and free of blockages.
steps.safety_notes: Follow manufacturer's instructions for cleaning.

steps.instruction: Reassemble the printer, closing all panels and access doors securely.
steps.expected_observation: Printer is fully reassembled and all panels are closed.

steps.instruction: Power the printer back on and print a test page or document.
steps.expected_observation: Printer powers on and prints successfully.

steps.instruction: If the printer is still experiencing issues after these steps, escalate to IT helpdesk.
steps.expected_observation: Printer still jammed or not functioning.

verify_prompts: Can you print a test page successfully?
Is the printer free of paper jams and operating normally?
escalate_requirements: Photos or description of jam location

doc_title: Troubleshooting Issues with Adobe Flash
title: General Troubleshooting for Adobe Flash Issues
summary: Steps to resolve common issues with Adobe Flash plugin in web browsers, including version checks, cache clearing, extension conflicts, and reinstalling.

steps.instruction: Go to the Adobe Flash Player website (www.adobe.com/software/flash/about) and click the 'Check Now' button to verify your Flash version.
steps.expected_observation: Current Flash version is displayed.

steps.instruction: Is an update available for Adobe Flash?
steps.expected_observation: Prompt to update or download new version appears.

steps.instruction: If an update is available, follow the prompts to download and install the latest version of Adobe Flash.
steps.expected_observation: Flash is updated to the latest version.

steps.instruction: Go to your browser's settings or preferences, find the Plugins or Add-ons section, locate Adobe Flash Player, and disable it
Wait for 10 seconds
re-enable it.
steps.expected_observation: Flash plugin is toggled off and then on again.

steps.instruction: Clear your browser's cache and cookies by pressing Ctrl+Shift+Delete (Windows) or Command+Shift+Delete (Mac), selecting cached data and cookies, confirming, and restarting the browser.
steps.expected_observation: Browser cache and cookies are cleared; browser restarts.

steps.instruction: Go to your browser's Extensions or Add-ons section
Disable each extension one by one, testing Adobe Flash after each disable
If an extension causes the issue, remove or update it.
steps.expected_observation: Problematic extension identified or ruled out.

steps.instruction: If using Windows, go to the Start menu, search for 'Windows Update', click 'Check for updates', install any available updates, and restart your system.
steps.expected_observation: Windows is updated and system is restarted.

steps.instruction: Uninstall Adobe Flash Player from Control Panel (Windows) or Applications folder (Mac)
Then, download and install the latest version from the Adobe Flash Player website.
steps.expected_observation: Adobe Flash Player is reinstalled.

verify_prompts: Check if Flash content now displays correctly in your browser.
Verify that the Flash plugin is enabled and working on a test website.

Browser version and operating system details

doc_title: Setting Up a Secure Connection to a Database
title: Set Up a Secure Database Connection
summary: Establish a secure connection to a database by gathering required information, installing drivers, configuring a secure connection string, enabling SSL/TLS, testing the connection, implementing secure authentication, and monitoring the connection.

steps.instruction: Gather the database server name or IP address, port number, username, password, and database name or schema from your database administrator or documentation.
steps.expected_observation: All required connection details are available.

steps.instruction: Install the necessary database drivers for your DBMS (e.g., Oracle Client for Oracle, MySQL Connector for MySQL).
steps.expected_observation: Database drivers are installed and recognized by your system.

steps.instruction: Create a connection string that includes the server, port, database name, username, and password, formatted for your DBMS.
steps.expected_observation: Connection string is constructed with all required parameters.

steps.instruction: Add SSL/TLS parameters to the connection string to enable encryption (e.g., for Oracle: ssl=true;oracle.net.ssl_version=1.2;oracle.net.ssl_cipher_suites=(TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256)).
steps.expected_observation: Connection string includes SSL/TLS parameters.
steps.safety_notes: Ensure the cipher suite and SSL version are supported by your DBMS and environment.

steps.instruction: Test the connection using a database tool or command-line utility (e.g., sqlplus for Oracle, mysql for MySQL).
steps.expected_observation: Successful connection message or prompt.

steps.instruction: Implement secure authentication mechanisms, such as password encryption or Kerberos authentication, according to your DBMS capabilities.
steps.expected_observation: Authentication method is configured and credentials are protected.
steps.safety_notes: Do not store plaintext passwords. Use encryption or secure vaults.

steps.instruction: Set up monitoring and auditing for the database connection, including logging connection attempts and monitoring activity.
steps.expected_observation: Monitoring and auditing are enabled and logs are being generated.

verify_prompts: Can you connect to the database securely using the configured connection string?
Is the connection encrypted (check connection properties or logs)?
escalate_requirements: Error messages or logs from connection attempts

steps.expected_observation: A clear outline for the article is prepared.

steps.expected_observation: Draft of the article is completed.

steps.expected_observation: Media is included in the article where appropriate.

steps.instruction: Review and edit the article for accuracy, completeness, and clarity. Ensure it meets knowledge base standards.
steps.expected_observation: Article is accurate, complete, and clear.

steps.instruction: Obtain approval from a supervisor or peer reviewer before publishing.
steps.expected_observation: Article is approved for publication.

steps.instruction: Publish the article to the knowledge base. Categorize and tag it with relevant keywords.
steps.expected_observation: Article is live and properly categorized in the knowledge base.

doc_title: Resetting a Computer's BIOS

steps.expected_observation: Computer is powered off.

steps.instruction: Locate the BIOS access key (usually F2, F12, Del, or Esc) for your computer model.
steps.expected_observation: You know which key to press to access BIOS.

steps.expected_observation: BIOS setup screen is displayed.

steps.instruction: Navigate to the 'Main' or 'System Information' tab and note the 'BIOS Version' or 'Firmware Version'.

steps.instruction: Navigate to the 'Advanced' or 'Configuration' tab and select 'Reset to Default' or 'Load Default Settings'
steps.safety_notes: Incorrect BIOS changes can cause system instability.

steps.instruction: Confirm the action when prompted.
steps.expected_observation: Confirmation prompt appears and defaults are loaded.
steps.safety_notes: Incorrect BIOS changes can cause system instability.

steps.instruction: Navigate to the 'Exit' or 'Save & Exit' tab and select 'Save Changes' or 'Save & Exit'. The computer will reboot.
steps.expected_observation: Computer restarts after saving changes.

steps.instruction: After reboot, enter the BIOS setup screen again and verify the BIOS version and that all settings are at default values.
steps.expected_observation: BIOS version unchanged, settings at default.

doc_title: Troubleshooting Issues with Microsoft Visio
title: Basic Troubleshooting for Microsoft Visio Issues
summary: Step-by-step guide to resolving common issues with Microsoft Visio, including restarting, updating, disabling add-ins, checking file compatibility, and system resources.

steps.instruction: Restart Microsoft Visio and your computer.
steps.expected_observation: Visio launches and functions normally.

steps.instruction: Check for updates in Visio: Go to File > Account > Update Options > Update Now.
steps.expected_observation: Visio updates successfully or confirms it is up to date.

steps.instruction: Disable all add-ins: Go to File > Options > Add-ins, uncheck each add-in, click OK, and restart Visio.
steps.expected_observation: Visio starts without issues. If resolved, re-enable add-ins one by one to identify the problematic add-in.

steps.instruction: Check file format and compatibility: Try opening the file in a different version of Visio or another diagramming tool
Save the file in a different format (e.g., .vsdx)
Check file permissions and ensure it is not read-only.
steps.expected_observation: File opens successfully or issue is identified as file-specific.

steps.instruction: Check system resources: Ensure at least 4 GB RAM (8 GB recommended), sufficient disk space, and a compatible processor.
steps.expected_observation: System meets or exceeds minimum requirements for Visio.

steps.instruction: Close all other applications and restart Visio. If the issue persists, uninstall any recently installed software or updates.
steps.expected_observation: Visio operates normally without conflicts.

steps.instruction: Repair or reinstall Visio: Go to Control Panel > Programs and Features (or Add or Remove Programs), uninstall Visio
steps.safety_notes: Uninstalling may remove user settings or customizations.

steps.instruction: reinstall from the Microsoft website or company repository.
steps.expected_observation: Visio installs and runs without issues.
steps.safety_notes: Uninstalling may remove user settings or customizations.

verify_prompts: Is Visio now launching and functioning as expected?
Can you open and edit your Visio files without errors?

doc_title: Creating a System Restore Point
title: Create a System Restore Point on Windows
summary: Guide to manually creating a system restore point on a Windows-based computer to enable system recovery in case of failure or malfunction.

steps.instruction: Access the System Properties window by either right-clicking on 'Computer' or 'This PC' and selecting 'Properties', or by pressing Windows key + Pause/Break.
steps.expected_observation: System Properties window opens.

steps.instruction: In the System Properties window, click on the 'System Protection' tab.
steps.expected_observation: 'System Protection' tab is displayed.

steps.instruction: In the System Protection tab, check the box next to the drive you want to use for restore points (usually C:)
steps.safety_notes: Ensure you have enough disk space allocated for restore points.

steps.instruction: Adjust the 'Max Usage' slider if needed.
steps.expected_observation: Selected drive is enabled for system protection.
steps.safety_notes: Ensure you have enough disk space allocated for restore points.

steps.instruction: Click the 'Create' button. When prompted, enter a description for the restore point and click 'Create' again.
steps.expected_observation: Restore point creation process starts with a progress bar.

steps.instruction: Wait for the restore point to be created. This may take a few minutes.
steps.expected_observation: Confirmation message appears when creation is complete.

steps.instruction: Click on the 'System Restore' button in the System Protection tab to view the list of available restore points
Confirm that your new restore point appears in the list.
steps.expected_observation: Newly created restore point is listed.

verify_prompts: Is the new restore point visible in the list of available restore points?
Did you receive a confirmation message after creation?
escalate_requirements: Screenshot of error or missing restore point

doc_title: Troubleshooting Issues with Company-Issued Smartwatches
title: Basic Troubleshooting for Company-Issued Smartwatches
summary: Step-by-step troubleshooting for common issues with company-issued smartwatches, including connectivity, app, and OS problems.

steps.instruction: Restart the smartwatch by pressing and holding the Power button until it shuts down
Wait 30 seconds
press the Power button again to turn it back on.
steps.expected_observation: Smartwatch restarts and boots to home screen.

steps.instruction: Ensure the smartwatch is connected to the company-issued phone or tablet
Open the companion app on the mobile device and check that the watch is paired correctly
If not, follow in-app instructions to reconnect.
steps.expected_observation: Smartwatch appears as paired in the companion app.

steps.instruction: Open the companion app on the mobile device and check for any available updates for the smartwatch
Follow in-app instructions to update the watch's operating system if needed.
steps.expected_observation: Smartwatch OS is up to date or update completes successfully.

steps.instruction: On the mobile device, go to Settings > Bluetooth and toggle Bluetooth off. Wait 10 seconds, then toggle it back on.
steps.expected_observation: Bluetooth reconnects and smartwatch regains connection if previously lost.

steps.instruction: Did the previous steps resolve the issue?
steps.expected_observation: Issue resolved or persists.

steps.instruction: If issue persists, perform a factory reset on the smartwatch
steps.safety_notes: Factory reset will erase all data on the smartwatch.

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > System > Reset on the smartwatch
steps.safety_notes: Factory reset will erase all data on the smartwatch.

steps.instruction: Ensure all data is synced to the companion app or cloud storage before proceeding.
steps.expected_observation: Smartwatch resets to factory settings and reboots.
steps.safety_notes: Factory reset will erase all data on the smartwatch.

steps.instruction: Is the issue related to a specific app?
steps.expected_observation: Yes or No.

steps.instruction: If yes, uninstall and reinstall the app on the smartwatch. Check the app's settings to ensure correct configuration.
steps.expected_observation: App functions correctly after reinstall and configuration.

steps.instruction: Did all previous steps resolve the issue?
steps.expected_observation: Issue resolved or persists.

steps.instruction: If the issue persists, escalate to Advanced Support for further troubleshooting or repair/replacement.
steps.expected_observation: Ticket escalated with all troubleshooting steps documented.

verify_prompts: Is the smartwatch functioning as expected after troubleshooting?
Does the smartwatch connect and sync with the companion app?
Are all intended apps and features working on the smartwatch?

doc_title: Configuring a Company-Issued Tablet for International Travel

summary: Prepare and secure a company-issued tablet for international travel by enabling roaming, configuring VPN and email, installing essential apps, and securing the device.
signatures: unable to access company email abroad
tablet not connecting to foreign networks

steps.instruction: Verify that your tablet's international roaming feature is enabled
Check with the mobile carrier (listed on the company's intranet) to ensure device compatibility and review international roaming rates and fees.
steps.expected_observation: International roaming is enabled and compatible; rates reviewed.

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Wireless & networks > Mobile networks
Enable International roaming
Set Preferred network type to Global or LTE/CDMA
Disable Wi-Fi calling.
steps.expected_observation: International roaming enabled, preferred network set, Wi-Fi calling disabled.

steps.instruction: Update email settings to use the company's VPN when accessing email outside the country
Install and configure the company-approved VPN client to connect to the company's VPN server.
steps.expected_observation: VPN client installed and configured; email set to use VPN.

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Wireless & networks > Mobile networks > International data roaming
Enable International data roaming and set a reasonable data roaming limit.
steps.expected_observation: International data roaming enabled and limit set.

steps.instruction: Install company-approved international travel apps (e.g., trip management, language translators) and ensure they are updated to the latest versions.
steps.expected_observation: Essential travel apps installed and updated.

steps.instruction: Enable Two-Factor Authentication (2FA). Set up a screen lock or biometric authentication. Install company-approved antivirus software.
steps.expected_observation: 2FA enabled, screen lock/biometric set, antivirus installed.

steps.instruction: Test the tablet's international roaming by connecting to a foreign network. Verify access to company email, VPN, and essential apps.
steps.expected_observation: Tablet connects to foreign network; email, VPN, and apps accessible.

verify_prompts: Can you connect to a foreign network and access company email, VPN, and essential apps on your tablet?
escalate_requirements: List of installed apps and versions

steps.expected_observation: Access to SharePoint site is granted.

doc_title: Troubleshooting Issues with a Slow-Performing Computer
title: Basic Troubleshooting for a Slow-Performing Windows Computer
summary: Step-by-step procedure to diagnose and resolve common causes of slow performance on a Windows computer.

steps.instruction: Press Ctrl + Shift + Esc to open Task Manager
steps.safety_notes: Do not end system-critical processes.

steps.instruction: In the Processes tab, identify applications or processes consuming high CPU or memory
steps.safety_notes: Do not end system-critical processes.

steps.instruction: Right-click and select 'End Task' for unnecessary items.
steps.expected_observation: Unnecessary programs and processes are closed, system resources are freed.
steps.safety_notes: Do not end system-critical processes.

steps.instruction: Press Windows + R, type 'msconfig', and press Enter
steps.safety_notes: Disabling essential startup programs may affect system functionality.

steps.instruction: Go to the Startup tab
steps.safety_notes: Disabling essential startup programs may affect system functionality.

steps.instruction: Uncheck unnecessary programs to disable them from starting automatically
steps.safety_notes: Disabling essential startup programs may affect system functionality.

steps.instruction: Click Apply and OK.
steps.expected_observation: Unnecessary startup programs are disabled.
steps.safety_notes: Disabling essential startup programs may affect system functionality.

steps.instruction: Open Settings from the Start menu. Go to Update & Security and click 'Check for updates'. Install any available updates.
steps.expected_observation: Operating system and software are up to date.

steps.instruction: Open File Explorer, right-click the C: drive, select Properties, and click 'Disk Cleanup'. Follow prompts to remove unnecessary files.
steps.expected_observation: Disk Cleanup completes and frees up disk space.

steps.instruction: Open your antivirus software and run a full system scan. Remove any detected malware or viruses.
steps.expected_observation: No malware found or all detected threats removed.

steps.instruction: Open File Explorer, right-click the C: drive, select Properties, go to the Tools tab, and click 'Check' under Error checking
steps.safety_notes: Running disk repair may require a restart.

steps.instruction: Follow prompts to repair disk errors.
steps.expected_observation: Disk check completes and repairs any errors found.
steps.safety_notes: Running disk repair may require a restart.

steps.instruction: If the computer is several years old, consider upgrading RAM or replacing the hard drive with an SSD
steps.safety_notes: Hardware upgrades should be performed by qualified personnel.

steps.instruction: Consult IT or a technician for guidance.
steps.expected_observation: Hardware upgrade options are identified.
steps.safety_notes: Hardware upgrades should be performed by qualified personnel.

verify_prompts: Is the computer's performance improved after completing these steps?
Are programs opening faster and system lag reduced?

doc_title: Troubleshooting Issues with Microsoft Publisher
title: Basic Troubleshooting for Microsoft Publisher Issues
summary: General troubleshooting steps for resolving common issues with Microsoft Publisher, such as crashes, errors, or unexpected behavior.

steps.instruction: Close all instances of Microsoft Publisher. Wait for 30 seconds, then reopen the application.
steps.expected_observation: Publisher opens normally without previous issue.

steps.instruction: Check for updates to Microsoft Publisher via Microsoft Store or the built-in update feature. Install any available updates.
steps.expected_observation: Publisher is up-to-date.

steps.instruction: Disable all Publisher add-ins
Restart Publisher
If the issue is resolved, re-enable add-ins one by one to identify the problematic plugin.
steps.expected_observation: Issue does not occur with add-ins disabled or after identifying the problematic add-in.

steps.instruction: Try opening a different Publisher file or create a new one. Does the issue persist?
steps.expected_observation: Issue only occurs with a specific file or with all files.

steps.instruction: If the issue is file-specific, attempt to repair the file using Publisher's repair tool or by saving it in a different format.
steps.expected_observation: File opens and works correctly after repair or conversion.

steps.instruction: Check printer settings. Ensure the correct printer, paper size, and orientation are selected.
steps.expected_observation: Printer settings are correct and Publisher prints as expected.

steps.instruction: Close all other applications and background programs. Restart Publisher.
steps.expected_observation: Issue does not occur when other programs are closed.

steps.instruction: Run the System File Checker (SFC) tool to scan and repair corrupted system files.
steps.expected_observation: No system file corruption detected or issues are repaired.
steps.safety_notes: Running SFC may require administrator privileges.

steps.instruction: If the issue persists, uninstall and reinstall Microsoft Publisher.
steps.expected_observation: Publisher is reinstalled and issue is resolved.
steps.safety_notes: Uninstalling Publisher will remove the application but should not affect user files.

doc_title: Setting Up a Secure Connection to a Database Server
title: Set Up a Secure Connection to a Database Server (General)
summary: Guide to enabling SSL/TLS encryption for secure database connections, including server and client configuration.

steps.instruction: Log in to the database server with administrative credentials
steps.safety_notes: Restarting the database server may cause a brief downtime.

steps.instruction: Navigate to the server configuration settings and enable SSL/TLS encryption
steps.safety_notes: Restarting the database server may cause a brief downtime.

steps.instruction: For MySQL, add the following to my.cnf: [mysqld] ssl-ca=/path/to/ca.crt ssl-cert=/path/to/server.crt ssl-key=/path/to/server.key
steps.expected_observation: SSL/TLS settings are enabled in the server configuration.
steps.safety_notes: Restarting the database server may cause a brief downtime.

steps.instruction: Restart the database server to apply SSL/TLS configuration changes.
steps.expected_observation: Database server restarts successfully.
steps.safety_notes: Ensure active connections are notified before restart.

steps.instruction: Generate a client certificate and private key using OpenSSL or a similar tool
Example: openssl req -x509 -newkey rsa:2048 -nodes -keyout client.key -out client.crt -days 365 -subj "/C=US/ST=State/L=Locality/O=Organization/CN=client"
steps.expected_observation: client.crt and client.key files are created.

steps.instruction: Configure your database client software to use the generated client certificate and private key
For MySQL Workbench: Edit > Preferences > SSL, select the certificate and key files.
steps.expected_observation: Client software is set to use the certificate and key.

steps.instruction: Establish a connection to the database server using the client software, ensuring SSL/TLS encryption is enabled (e.g., select the SSL option in connection settings).
steps.expected_observation: Connection to the database server is established.

steps.instruction: Verify the secure connection by checking the connection status in the client software or by running: openssl s_client -connect <database_server_host>:<database_server_port> -showcerts
steps.expected_observation: SSL/TLS certificate details are displayed and connection is reported as secure.

verify_prompts: Is the database client reporting a secure (SSL/TLS) connection?
Does openssl s_client show valid certificate details for the server?
escalate_requirements: Exact database server and client software versions

doc_title: Troubleshooting Issues with a Jammed Copier
title: Basic Troubleshooting for a Jammed Copier
summary: Step-by-step procedure to safely clear a paper jam in a copier and restore normal operation.

steps.instruction: Check the copier's control panel for any error message or symptom. Note the exact message displayed.
steps.expected_observation: Error message such as 'Paper Jam', 'Misfeed', or 'Output Tray Full' is visible.

steps.instruction: Switch off the copier using the power button, then unplug it from the power outlet.
steps.expected_observation: Copier is powered off and unplugged.
steps.safety_notes: Ensures safety and prevents electrical shock.

steps.instruction: Check the control panel or LCD for indicators of the jam location. If none, visually inspect the copier's exterior and interior.
steps.expected_observation: Jam location is identified or suspected.

steps.instruction: Open the necessary covers (top, front, or both) to access the jammed area. Refer to the user manual if unsure.
steps.expected_observation: Covers are open and jammed area is accessible.

steps.instruction: Gently pull out any visible paper scraps or torn pages from the jammed area. Do not push paper further inside.
steps.expected_observation: All visible paper debris is removed.
steps.safety_notes: Be gentle to avoid damaging internal components.

steps.instruction: Inspect for and remove any objects causing the jam, such as paper clips, staples, or torn fragments.
steps.expected_observation: No foreign objects remain in the jammed area.

steps.instruction: Inspect and clean the paper path using a soft-bristled brush or lint-free cloth to remove dust and debris.
steps.expected_observation: Paper path is clean and free of debris.

steps.instruction: Reattach all covers or panels securely in the reverse order of removal.
steps.expected_observation: All covers and panels are closed and secured.

steps.instruction: Plug the copier back in and turn it on. If available, press the reset button to clear error messages.
steps.expected_observation: Copier powers on and error messages are cleared.

steps.instruction: Print a test page or copy a document to verify the copier is functioning.
steps.expected_observation: Test page prints successfully or document is copied without error.

steps.instruction: Did the copier function correctly after testing?
steps.expected_observation: Copier works as expected or issue persists.

verify_prompts: Is the copier able to print or copy a document without displaying a jam error?
Does the control panel show 'Ready' or normal status after clearing the jam?
escalate_requirements: Take a photo or screenshot of the error message.
Record the copier model and serial number.
Note the time and frequency of the issue.

title: Basic Troubleshooting for Company-Issued Desktops
summary: Step-by-step guidance for helpdesk specialists to troubleshoot common issues with company-issued desktops, including hardware, software, and network checks.

steps.instruction: Ask the user to describe the issue, including any error messages or beeps
Verify the user's identity and authorization
Record the desktop's asset tag and serial number.
steps.expected_observation: User provides details and device identifiers.

steps.instruction: Restart the desktop. Check all cables and power connections to ensure they are secure.
steps.expected_observation: Desktop powers on and connections are secure.

steps.instruction: Check the desktop's event logs for hardware-related errors or warnings.
steps.expected_observation: Event logs show hardware status.

steps.instruction: Run a diagnostic test on the hard drive using the built-in disk checking utility.
steps.expected_observation: Diagnostic results indicate disk health.

steps.instruction: Ensure the desktop's vents are clear and the system is in a well-ventilated area.
steps.expected_observation: Vents are clear and airflow is unobstructed.

steps.instruction: Check for any recently installed software or updates that may be causing the issue.
steps.expected_observation: Recent changes identified or ruled out.

steps.instruction: Run a virus scan to detect and remove any malware.
steps.expected_observation: Virus scan completes and reports status.

steps.instruction: Verify the operating system and software are up-to-date with the latest patches.
steps.expected_observation: System is up-to-date or updates are installed.

steps.instruction: Check the network cable connection and ensure it is securely plugged in.
steps.expected_observation: Network cable is secure.

steps.instruction: Verify the desktop is connected to the correct network and can ping the default gateway.
steps.expected_observation: Desktop can ping the default gateway.

steps.instruction: Check for any issues with the user's network account or permissions.
steps.expected_observation: Account and permissions are correct.

steps.instruction: Use remote desktop tools to access the desktop and run advanced diagnostic tests.
steps.expected_observation: Remote diagnostics complete with results.

steps.instruction: Check the BIOS settings to ensure they are configured correctly.
steps.expected_observation: BIOS settings are correct.

steps.instruction: Run a system file checker to identify and repair any corrupted system files.
steps.expected_observation: System file checker completes and reports status.

steps.instruction: If the issue is not resolved after all steps, escalate to the next level of support.
steps.expected_observation: Issue persists after troubleshooting.

verify_prompts: Is the desktop now functioning as expected?
Can the user log in and perform their tasks without issues?
escalate_requirements: Detailed documentation of troubleshooting steps taken
Asset tag and serial number of the desktop

doc_title: Resetting a Computer's DNS Settings
title: Reset DNS Settings on Windows
summary: Reset the DNS settings on a Windows computer to resolve connectivity and DNS-related issues.

steps.instruction: Open the Command Prompt as an Administrator
Right-click Start and select 'Command Prompt (Admin)', or search for 'cmd', right-click, and choose 'Run as administrator'.
steps.expected_observation: Command Prompt window opens with administrator privileges.

steps.instruction: In the Command Prompt, type 'ipconfig /flushdns' and press Enter.
steps.expected_observation: A message confirms the DNS Resolver Cache was successfully flushed.

steps.instruction: Type 'ipconfig /release' and press Enter.
steps.expected_observation: IP address is released; network connection may temporarily drop.

steps.instruction: Type 'ipconfig /renew' and press Enter.
steps.expected_observation: A new IP address is obtained from the DHCP server.

steps.instruction: Type 'dnscache -flush' and press Enter.
steps.expected_observation: DNS resolver cache is cleared.

steps.instruction: Type 'ipconfig /all' and press Enter. Check that DNS server addresses are set to obtain automatically.
steps.expected_observation: DNS server addresses are set to automatic.

steps.instruction: Restart your computer to ensure changes take effect.
steps.expected_observation: Computer restarts successfully.

verify_prompts: Can you access the internet and company resources after restarting?
Are DNS settings set to obtain addresses automatically in 'ipconfig /all'?
escalate_requirements: Description of the issue after DNS reset

doc_title: Resetting a Computer's DNS Settings
title: Reset DNS Settings on Mac
summary: Reset the DNS settings on a Mac computer to resolve connectivity and DNS-related issues.

steps.instruction: Open the Terminal application (Applications > Utilities > Terminal or use Spotlight search).
steps.expected_observation: Terminal window opens.

steps.instruction: In Terminal, type 'sudo killall -HUP mDNSResponder' and press Enter. Enter your password if prompted.
steps.expected_observation: No output if successful; DNS cache is flushed.

steps.instruction: Type 'sudo discoveryutil udnsflushcaches' and press Enter.
steps.expected_observation: No output if successful; DNS resolver cache is cleared.

steps.instruction: Go to Apple menu > System Preferences > Network
Select your connection, click Advanced
TCP/IP tab
Ensure DNS is set to obtain addresses automatically.
steps.expected_observation: DNS server addresses are set to automatic.

steps.instruction: Restart your computer to ensure changes take effect.
steps.expected_observation: Computer restarts successfully.

verify_prompts: Can you access the internet and company resources after restarting?
Are DNS settings set to obtain addresses automatically in Network preferences?
escalate_requirements: Screenshots of Network > Advanced > TCP/IP tab
Description of the issue after DNS reset

doc_title: Troubleshooting Issues with a Slow-Performing Network
title: Basic Troubleshooting for Slow Network Performance
summary: Step-by-step procedure for helpdesk specialists to identify and resolve common causes of slow network performance.

steps.instruction: Identify the scope of the issue (single user, department, or organization)
Determine the type of devices and operating systems affected
Ask the user to describe the symptoms, including any error messages or specific behaviors.
steps.expected_observation: Clear understanding of affected users, devices, and symptoms.

steps.instruction: Verify the user's device is connected to the correct network (wired or wireless)
Check the network cable or Wi-Fi connection for damage or interference
Ensure the device's network settings (IP address, subnet mask, gateway) are configured correctly.
steps.expected_observation: Device is properly connected and network settings are correct.

steps.instruction: Restart the user's device. If the issue persists, restart the router or switch.
steps.expected_observation: Network performance improves after restart.

steps.instruction: Use built-in network diagnostic tools (e.g., Windows Network Diagnostics, macOS Network Utility)
Run a speed test (e.g., Speedtest.net)
Check for firmware or driver updates for the network adapter or router.
steps.expected_observation: Diagnostic results and current network speed are available.

steps.instruction: Identify any resource-intensive applications running on the user's device
Ask the user to close unnecessary applications or background processes
Check for malware or viruses.
steps.expected_observation: Resource usage is reduced and no malware detected.

steps.instruction: Check network utilization using tools like Network Monitor or Wireshark
Identify any bottlenecks or high-traffic areas
Consider implementing Quality of Service (QoS) policies.
steps.expected_observation: Network congestion or bottlenecks identified.

steps.instruction: If the issue persists after all steps, escalate to the network infrastructure team with detailed documentation of troubleshooting steps and diagnostic results.

verify_prompts: Is the network speed now within expected parameters?
Can the user access network resources without delay?
Has the user reported improvement in network performance?
escalate_requirements: Detailed documentation of troubleshooting steps taken
List of affected devices and users
Screenshots of error messages or network settings

doc_title: Configuring a Network Fax Machine

summary: Step-by-step instructions for connecting and configuring a network fax machine (Xerox WorkCentre 3335 or Canon imageCLASS LBP6230dw) to work with the company's network infrastructure.

Access the administration interface via web browser using the current IP address (default: 192.168.1.100)
Log in with admin credentials (Username: admin, Password: password).

Enter the assigned static IP address, subnet mask, default gateway, and DNS server addresses
Save changes and restart the fax machine.

Enter the company's fax domain (e.g., fax.example.com)
Set Fax Resolution to Fine and Fax Compression to MH
Save changes.
steps.expected_observation: Fax settings saved successfully.

steps.instruction: If email notifications are desired, navigate to Email Settings
Enter the company's email server address (e.g., mail.example.com)
Set Email Protocol to SMTP
Enter the fax machine's email address (e.g., fax@example.com)
Save changes.
steps.expected_observation: Email settings saved successfully.

steps.instruction: Send a test fax to the fax machine using an external fax number. Verify the fax is received.
steps.expected_observation: Fax machine receives the test fax.

steps.instruction: If email notifications are configured, verify that an email notification is received for the incoming fax.
steps.expected_observation: Email notification for the incoming fax is received.

verify_prompts: Is the fax machine accessible at the assigned static IP address?

doc_title: Resetting a Computer's DHCP Settings

steps.expected_observation: Current IP address is released.

steps.instruction: Type 'ipconfig /renew' and press Enter.
steps.expected_observation: A new IP address is obtained from the DHCP server.

doc_title: Troubleshooting Issues with Microsoft Project
title: Basic Troubleshooting for Microsoft Project Issues
summary: A step-by-step procedure to resolve common issues with Microsoft Project, including installation, updates, add-ins, file integrity, conflicting applications, system resources, and resetting settings.

steps.instruction: Check if Microsoft Project is installed by looking in the Start menu or Applications folder.
steps.expected_observation: Microsoft Project is present in the Start menu or Applications folder.

steps.instruction: If Microsoft Project is not installed, install it from the company's software repository or contact IT for assistance.
steps.expected_observation: Microsoft Project is installed and visible in the Start menu or Applications folder.

steps.instruction: Open Microsoft Project and go to File > Account > Update Options > Update Now. Install any available updates and restart the application.
steps.expected_observation: Microsoft Project is up to date and restarts successfully.

steps.instruction: Go to File > Options > Add-ins and uncheck all add-ins. Restart Microsoft Project.
steps.expected_observation: Microsoft Project starts without issues after disabling add-ins.

steps.instruction: Does disabling add-ins resolve the issue?
steps.expected_observation: Issue is resolved after disabling add-ins.

steps.instruction: If the issue is resolved, re-enable add-ins one by one to identify the problematic add-in.
steps.expected_observation: Problematic add-in is identified.

steps.instruction: Try opening a different project file
If the issue only occurs with a specific file, attempt to repair it via File > Info > Organizer > Repair.
steps.expected_observation: Other project files open without issue or the problematic file is repaired.

steps.instruction: Close all other applications and restart Microsoft Project
If the issue resolves, reopen other applications one by one to identify any conflict.
steps.expected_observation: Conflicting application is identified if the issue returns.

steps.instruction: Check system RAM, CPU, and disk space to ensure they meet minimum requirements
Close other resource-intensive applications and try running Microsoft Project again.
steps.expected_observation: Microsoft Project runs smoothly after freeing up system resources.

steps.instruction: Reset Microsoft Project settings to default via File > Options > Reset and follow the prompts.
steps.expected_observation: Microsoft Project settings are reset and issue is checked again.

steps.instruction: If none of the above steps resolve the issue, contact the IT department. Provide error messages, steps taken, and troubleshooting attempts.
steps.expected_observation: IT department receives all relevant information for further troubleshooting.

verify_prompts: Is Microsoft Project now opening and functioning as expected?
Can you open and edit project files without errors?
Are all required features working after troubleshooting?
Verify the plugin/add-in is enabled and visible (e.g., the tab/ribbon appears).

Obtain it from IT or the company intranet
Follow device/browser instructions to install the certificate.
steps.expected_observation: Device/browser trusts the company SSL certificate.

steps.instruction: Configure your browser to use the company's proxy server. Enter the proxy address provided by IT in your browser's settings.
steps.expected_observation: Browser is configured to use the company proxy.

steps.instruction: When prompted, authenticate with your company credentials (username and password).
steps.expected_observation: Authentication is successful and website loads.

steps.instruction: Verify that the website content is correct and you have access to the required resources.
steps.expected_observation: Website displays expected content and resources are accessible.

Is the browser showing a secure connection (padlock icon)?

doc_title: Resetting a Computer's DNS Cache
title: Reset DNS Cache on Windows
summary: Flush the DNS cache on a Windows computer to resolve domain name resolution and internet connectivity issues.

steps.instruction: Open the Command Prompt as an administrator. Right-click on the Start button and select 'Command Prompt (Admin)'.
steps.expected_observation: Command Prompt window opens with administrator privileges.

steps.instruction: Type the command: ipconfig /flushdns and press Enter.
steps.expected_observation: A message appears indicating that the DNS cache has been successfully flushed.

steps.instruction: Close the Command Prompt window.
steps.expected_observation: Command Prompt window is closed.

verify_prompts: Check if you can now access previously unreachable websites.
escalate_requirements: Description of the issue before and after reset

doc_title: Resetting a Computer's DNS Cache
title: Reset DNS Cache on Mac OS X
summary: Flush the DNS cache on a Mac to resolve domain name resolution and internet connectivity issues.

steps.instruction: Open the Terminal application (in Applications/Utilities or via Spotlight).
steps.expected_observation: Terminal window opens.

steps.instruction: Type the command: dscacheutil -flushcache; sudo killall -HUP mDNSResponder and press Enter.
steps.expected_observation: A message appears indicating the DNS cache has been flushed.

steps.instruction: Close the Terminal window.
steps.expected_observation: Terminal window is closed.

verify_prompts: Check if websites load correctly after flushing the DNS cache.
escalate_requirements: Description of the issue before and after reset

doc_title: Resetting a Computer's DNS Cache
title: Reset DNS Cache on Linux (Ubuntu-based)
summary: Flush the DNS cache on Ubuntu-based Linux distributions to resolve domain name resolution and internet connectivity issues.

steps.instruction: Open the Terminal application.
steps.expected_observation: Terminal window opens.

steps.instruction: Type the command: sudo service dns-clean start and press Enter.
steps.expected_observation: A message appears indicating the DNS cache has been flushed.

steps.instruction: Close the Terminal window.
steps.expected_observation: Terminal window is closed.

verify_prompts: Test if previously inaccessible websites are now reachable.
escalate_requirements: Description of the issue before and after reset

doc_title: Resetting a Computer's DNS Cache
title: Reset DNS Cache on Chrome OS
summary: Clear the DNS cache on Chrome OS using the Chrome browser to resolve domain name resolution and internet connectivity issues.

steps.instruction: Open the Chrome browser and type chrome://net-internals/#dns in the address bar.
steps.expected_observation: The DNS internals page loads in Chrome.

steps.instruction: Click on the 'Clear host cache' button.
steps.expected_observation: Host cache is cleared (no explicit message).

steps.instruction: Close the Chrome browser.
steps.expected_observation: Chrome browser is closed.

verify_prompts: Try accessing a website that was previously not loading.
escalate_requirements: Description of the issue before and after reset

doc_title: Configuring a Company-Issued Device for International Travel
title: Configure Company-Issued Device for International Travel
summary: Prepare a company-issued device for secure and reliable use during international travel by enabling roaming, configuring Wi-Fi, installing VPN, updating software, and notifying IT.

steps.instruction: Verify that your company-issued device supports international roaming by checking the manufacturer's website or contacting the IT helpdesk.
steps.expected_observation: Device is confirmed to support international roaming.

steps.instruction: On your device, go to Settings > Wireless & networks > Mobile networks > International roaming. Enable international roaming.
steps.expected_observation: International roaming is enabled.

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Wireless & networks > Mobile networks > Data roaming
steps.safety_notes: Setting data roaming to unlimited may incur charges; confirm with your company policy.

steps.instruction: Select International data roaming and set Data roaming limit to Unlimited.
steps.expected_observation: Data roaming is enabled and set to unlimited.
steps.safety_notes: Setting data roaming to unlimited may incur charges; confirm with your company policy.

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Wireless & networks > Wi-Fi. Disable Wi-Fi, enable Wi-Fi scanning, and set Wi-Fi sleep policy to Never.
steps.expected_observation: Wi-Fi is disabled, scanning is enabled, and sleep policy is set to Never.
steps.safety_notes: Disabling Wi-Fi prevents accidental connections to unsecured networks.

steps.instruction: Download and install the company-approved VPN software from the company repository. Configure it according to provided instructions.
steps.expected_observation: VPN software is installed and configured.
steps.safety_notes: Only use company-approved VPN software.

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > About device > System update. Install any available updates.
steps.expected_observation: Device software is up-to-date.
steps.safety_notes: Ensure updates are completed before travel.

steps.instruction: Inform the IT helpdesk of your international travel plans, including destination and travel dates.
steps.expected_observation: IT helpdesk is notified.

verify_prompts: Is international roaming enabled and working on your device?
Is the VPN software installed and able to connect?
Is your device software up-to-date?
Have you notified the IT helpdesk of your travel plans?
escalate_requirements: Screenshots of device settings (roaming, VPN, updates)

doc_title: Setting Up a New User's Account in Dropbox
title: Set Up a New User Account in Dropbox
summary: Procedure for creating and configuring a new user account in Dropbox, assigning team folders, setting account preferences, enabling 2FA, and verifying access.

steps.instruction: Navigate to the Dropbox admin console
Click on 'Users' in the top navigation menu
Click on 'Invite users' and enter the new user's email address, first name, and last name.
steps.expected_observation: New user appears in the user list.

steps.instruction: Click on 'Team Folders' in the top navigation menu
Select the appropriate team folder and click 'Add members.' Enter the new user's email address and set their permission level to 'Editor' or 'Viewer' as appropriate.
steps.expected_observation: User is listed as a member of the team folder with the correct permission.

steps.instruction: Click on the 'Users' tab and select the new user's account
Click on 'Settings' and set the user's preferred language, time zone, a temporary password, and account type ('Full account' or 'Limited account').
steps.expected_observation: User's settings reflect the configured values.

steps.instruction: Click on 'Security' and enable two-factor authentication (2FA) for the new user.
steps.expected_observation: 2FA is enabled for the user.

steps.instruction: Send the new user an email with a link to the Dropbox login page, their temporary password, instructions on changing their password, and information on accessing their assigned team folders.
steps.expected_observation: User receives the welcome email with all required information.

steps.instruction: Log in as the new user and verify access to the assigned team folders.
steps.expected_observation: User can log in and access the assigned team folders.

verify_prompts: Can the new user log in and access their assigned team folders?
Did the user receive the welcome email with instructions and temporary password?
escalate_requirements: Screenshot of user list showing new user

doc_title: Setting Up a New User's Account in Dropbox
title: Troubleshoot New User Access Issues in Dropbox
summary: Troubleshooting steps if a new user cannot access their Dropbox account or assigned team folders.

steps.instruction: Verify that the new user's email address is spelled correctly in the admin console.
steps.expected_observation: Email address matches the intended user.

steps.instruction: Check that the new user has received the welcome email from Dropbox.
steps.expected_observation: User confirms receipt of the welcome email.

steps.instruction: Verify that the user has been assigned the correct permission level (Editor or Viewer) and that the team folder is shared with them.
steps.expected_observation: User is listed as a member of the team folder with the correct permission.

verify_prompts: Can the user now access their account and assigned team folders?

Screenshot of team folder membership and permissions

doc_title: Creating a New IT Problem
title: Create a New IT Problem Ticket via IT Helpdesk Portal
summary: Guide for employees to create a new IT problem ticket using the company IT Helpdesk portal, ensuring all necessary information is provided for efficient resolution.

steps.instruction: Navigate to the IT Helpdesk portal via the provided link, by searching 'IT Helpdesk' on the intranet, or through the employee portal.
steps.expected_observation: IT Helpdesk portal login page is displayed.

steps.instruction: Log in to the IT Helpdesk portal using your employee credentials.
steps.expected_observation: Successfully logged in to the portal.

steps.instruction: Click on the 'Create a New Problem' button at the top right corner of the page.
steps.expected_observation: 'Create a New Problem' form is displayed.

steps.instruction: Select the appropriate problem category from the dropdown list (Hardware, Software, Network, Email, Other).
steps.expected_observation: Category selected in the form.

steps.instruction: Enter a concise and detailed description of your issue in the 'Problem Description' field, including error messages, troubleshooting steps taken, recent changes, and frequency/duration.
steps.expected_observation: Problem description entered in the form.

steps.instruction: Optionally, attach any supporting documentation (screenshots, log files) by clicking the 'Add Attachment' button.
steps.expected_observation: Attachments uploaded (if any).

steps.instruction: Enter your contact information (name, email address, phone number) in the designated fields.
steps.expected_observation: Contact information entered.

steps.instruction: Click the 'Submit' button to create the new IT problem ticket.
steps.expected_observation: Confirmation message and ticket number displayed; automated email received.

verify_prompts: Did you receive a confirmation message and ticket number after submitting?
Did you receive an automated email with your ticket number?
Can you see your new problem ticket listed in the IT Helpdesk portal?
escalate_requirements: Screenshots of the submission process or error messages

doc_title: Troubleshooting Issues with a Slow-Performing Computer
title: Basic Troubleshooting for Slow Computer Performance
summary: Step-by-step procedure to identify and resolve common causes of slow computer performance.

steps.instruction: Restart the computer to clear temporary files and refresh the system.
steps.expected_observation: Computer restarts successfully.

steps.instruction: Open Task Manager and sort processes by CPU or Memory usage
Identify and close any programs consuming high resources
Check Startup programs and disable unnecessary ones.
steps.expected_observation: Resource-intensive programs are closed or disabled.

steps.instruction: Check for and install updates for the operating system and all installed software.
steps.expected_observation: System and software are up-to-date.

steps.instruction: Press Windows key + R, type 'msconfig', press Enter, and disable unnecessary programs in the Startup tab.
steps.expected_observation: Unnecessary startup programs are disabled.

steps.instruction: Run a full scan with updated antivirus software to detect and remove malware.
steps.expected_observation: No malware detected or malware removed.

steps.instruction: Press Windows key + R, type '%temp%', press Enter, and delete all temporary files and folders.
steps.expected_observation: Temporary files are deleted.
steps.safety_notes: Ensure no important files are deleted.

steps.instruction: Check available disk space using File Explorer (Windows) or Finder (Mac). Delete unnecessary files or expand storage if disk space is low.
steps.expected_observation: Sufficient disk space available.

steps.instruction: Open Device Manager, look for devices with a yellow exclamation mark, and update their drivers.
steps.expected_observation: Drivers are up-to-date.

steps.instruction: If using a traditional hard drive, open Disk Defragmenter (Windows) or Optimize Storage (Mac) and defragment the disk.
steps.expected_observation: Disk defragmentation completes successfully.
steps.safety_notes: Do not interrupt the defragmentation process.

steps.instruction: If the issue persists after all steps, escalate to level 2 support or desktop support team.

verify_prompts: Is the computer performing at normal speed after completing these steps?
Are applications opening and running without noticeable delay?
escalate_requirements: Screenshots of Task Manager showing resource usage
Details of any error messages or warnings

doc_title: Setting Up a Secure Connection to a Company-Issued Server
title: Set up a secure connection to a company-issued server using Cisco AnyConnect
summary: Install Cisco AnyConnect, authenticate with company credentials, and connect to the appropriate company server.

steps.instruction: Open the Company Software Portal and search for 'Cisco AnyConnect'
Download and install the Cisco AnyConnect VPN client by following the on-screen instructions.
steps.expected_observation: Cisco AnyConnect is installed on the device.

steps.instruction: Launch the Cisco AnyConnect application from the start menu or application folder. Click on 'Connect' to begin.
steps.expected_observation: Cisco AnyConnect application opens and prompts for credentials.

steps.instruction: Enter your company login credentials (username and password) in the appropriate fields and click 'OK'.
steps.expected_observation: Authentication is successful or an error message is displayed.

steps.instruction: From the 'Group' dropdown menu, select the server you need to connect to (e.g., Finance Server, Marketing Server). Click 'Connect'.
steps.expected_observation: Connection process to the selected server begins.

steps.instruction: Wait for the connection to establish. Confirm that you see a message indicating you are now connected to the company-issued server.
steps.expected_observation: Confirmation message of successful connection is displayed.

verify_prompts: Do you see a confirmation message indicating you are connected to the company-issued server?
Can you access company resources that require VPN?

doc_title: Setting Up a Secure Connection to a Company-Issued Server
title: Troubleshoot VPN connection issues with Cisco AnyConnect
summary: Basic troubleshooting steps if unable to connect to the company server using Cisco AnyConnect.

steps.instruction: Ensure that your device's firewall and antivirus software are not blocking the VPN connection.
steps.expected_observation: Firewall/antivirus settings allow VPN traffic.
steps.safety_notes: Changing firewall or antivirus settings may reduce device security. Restore settings after troubleshooting.

steps.instruction: Verify that your company login credentials are correct and up-to-date.
steps.expected_observation: Credentials are accepted by Cisco AnyConnect.

steps.instruction: If issues persist, contact the IT Helpdesk for further assistance.

doc_title: Resetting a Forgotten Network Username.
title: Reset Forgotten Network Username via Helpdesk
summary: Procedure for users who have forgotten their network username and need to reset it with the help of the IT helpdesk.

steps.instruction: Try to recall your network username by checking your company ID, email signature, or any documentation that may list your username.
steps.expected_observation: User finds or does not find their username.

steps.instruction: Contact the IT helpdesk via phone, email, or online ticketing system. Provide your name, department, and a brief description of the issue.
steps.expected_observation: Helpdesk ticket created or contact established.

steps.instruction: Be prepared to verify your identity with the helpdesk specialist by providing your employee ID number, birthdate, or other identifying information.
steps.expected_observation: Identity verification successful.

steps.instruction: The helpdesk specialist will reset your network username and prompt you to create a new password that meets company policy (minimum 12 characters, includes uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters).
steps.expected_observation: Username reset and new password set.
steps.safety_notes: Do not share your new username or password with others.

steps.instruction: Update your password on all devices that use your network credentials (laptop, desktop, mobile devices, etc.).
steps.expected_observation: Devices are updated with new credentials.

steps.instruction: Log in to the company network using your new username and password.
steps.expected_observation: Successful login to the company network.

steps.instruction: If you encounter issues logging in, contact the helpdesk for further assistance.
steps.expected_observation: User contacts helpdesk if problems persist.

verify_prompts: Are you able to log in to the company network with your new username and password?
Have all your devices been updated with the new credentials?
